remarks: Compute the ` X ` coefficient in a sum with an independent vector ` X ` (first conjunct), which can then be removed to continue with the remaining vectors summed in expressions ` Y ` and ` Z ` (second conjunct).  Typically, ` U ` is the span of the remaining vectors. (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)
statement:
lvecindp.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lvecindp.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` W ) $.
lvecindp.f $e |- F = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lvecindp.k $e |- K = ( Base ` F ) $.
lvecindp.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` W ) $.
lvecindp.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lvecindp.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lvecindp.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lvecindp.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lvecindp.n $e |- ( ph -> -. X e. U ) $.
lvecindp.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. U ) $.
lvecindp.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. U ) $.
lvecindp.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. K ) $.
lvecindp.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. K ) $.
lvecindp.e $e |- ( ph -> ( ( A .x. X ) .+ Y ) = ( ( B .x. X ) .+ Z ) ) $.
lvecindp $p |- ( ph -> ( A = B /\ Y = Z ) ) $.
